subject: Personal Finance
title: Overconfidence Effect
description: A quick, practical guide to Overconfidence Effect.

hook.text: 74% of fund managers believe they're above average. Mathematically, that's impossible.

buildup.text: Overconfidence bias makes us overestimate our knowledge, abilities, and predictions.

discovery.text: Overconfident traders trade more frequently. More trades mean more fees and usually worse returns.

twist.text: Men are statistically more overconfident in investing. Studies show they trade 45% more and earn less.

climax.text: The cure isn't less confidence â€” it's tracking your predictions to see how accurate you really are.

quiz.question: How does overconfidence affect trading performance?
options: It leads to excessive trading and lower returns
It has no effect on returns
